channel.title: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}
channel.description:
I need help editing the EXP rates for my RSC private server, the server is run on Divine PK V5.0. I have found most things such as how to change what monsters drop on death, and how to change items to F2P or P2P. But the one thing I just can't find is how to change the EXP rates.
Thanks in advance for any help that someone can provide to me.

item.title: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Zian, post:19, topic:236709”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312431.msg2489803#msg2489803 date=1224033615]

It does not seem to work, I have edited the 60.0 to say .5 and it still has HIGH EXP. Yes I have recompiled the server, Yes EVERY thing was turned off before I recompiled & rebooted my server. Any ideas of what is wrong? or did I not edit all the right info.?

I am looking at

	  			int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
	  			switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle()) 
	  			{
					case 0:
						for(int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
							attackerPlayer.incExp(x, exp / 3);
							
						break;
					case 1:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(2, exp);
						break;
					case 2:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(0, exp);
						break;
					case 3:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(1, exp);
						break;
				}
				
	  			attackerPlayer.incExp(3, exp / 3);
	  			attackerPlayer.getActionSender().sendStats();

and I don’t know what (((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5); is about? does that mean you get 2 times EXP for your opponents combat lv? then plus 10 then times 1.5? sorry but I just don’t get what that is about,
[/quote]Yes, you’re right. Although it’s for both npcs and players.

Ok could you please tell me settings that would put it close to normal EXP rates like how it was for RSC when Jagex used to host it…[/quote]Umm, I’m not sure since I suck at formulaes but maybe (((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 1) + 10) * 1.5);

Read full topic
item.source: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}

item.title: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:18, topic:236709”][quote author=Zian link=topic=312431.msg2489796#msg2489796 date=1224033306]
It does not seem to work, I have edited the 60.0 to say .5 and it still has HIGH EXP. Yes I have recompiled the server, Yes EVERY thing was turned off before I recompiled & rebooted my server. Any ideas of what is wrong? or did I not edit all the right info.?

I am looking at

	  			int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
	  			switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle()) 
	  			{
					case 0:
						for(int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
							attackerPlayer.incExp(x, exp / 3);
							
						break;
					case 1:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(2, exp);
						break;
					case 2:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(0, exp);
						break;
					case 3:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(1, exp);
						break;
				}
				
	  			attackerPlayer.incExp(3, exp / 3);
	  			attackerPlayer.getActionSender().sendStats();

and I don’t know what (((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5); is about? does that mean you get 2 times EXP for your opponents combat lv? then plus 10 then times 1.5? sorry but I just don’t get what that is about,
[/quote]Yes, you’re right. Although it’s for both npcs and players.[/quote]

Ok could you please tell me settings that would put it close to normal EXP rates like how it was for RSC when Jagex used to host it…

Read full topic

I am looking at

	  			int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
	  			switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle()) 
	  			{
					case 0:

and I don’t know what (((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5); is about? does that mean you get 2 times EXP for your opponents combat lv? then plus 10 then times 1.5? sorry but I just don’t get what that is about,[/quote]Yes, you’re right. Although it’s for both npcs and players.

item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

It does not seem to work, I have edited the 60.0 to say .5 and it still has HIGH EXP. Yes I have recompiled the server, Yes EVERY thing was turned off before I recompiled & rebooted my server. Any ideas of what is wrong? or did I not edit all the right info.?

I am looking at

	  			int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
	  			switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle()) 
	  			{
					case 0:
						for(int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
							attackerPlayer.incExp(x, exp / 3);
							
						break;
					case 1:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(2, exp);
						break;
					case 2:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(0, exp);
						break;
					case 3:
						attackerPlayer.incExp(1, exp);
						break;
				}
				
	  			attackerPlayer.incExp(3, exp / 3);
	  			attackerPlayer.getActionSender().sendStats();

and I don’t know what (((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5); is about? does that mean you get 2 times EXP for your opponents combat lv? then plus 10 then times 1.5? sorry but I just don’t get what that is about,

item.title: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}
item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian
item.description:
@Zian wrote:

[quote=“bigh51, post:11, topic:236709”][quote author=Zian link=topic=312431.msg2489753#msg2489753 date=1224031578]
I launched my server after editing

 * This player's 'rank'
	 */
	private int rank = 0;
	
	/**
	 * The multiplier for subscribed players.
	 */
	private double premiumMultiplier = 60.0;

I edited the 60.0 to 1.0 but my EXP rates still seem to be a bit high/insane, does any one know the number I would have to put it at to make it normal EXP rates?

Oh, did I make a noob java mistake by not recompiling the server? or is recompiling it not needed?
[/quote]You have to rcompile the server, then restart it…[/quote]

oh ok thanks. do you know where the account info. is saved/stored and how do i edit it?/

Sorry about all the questions… But I am new to java/private server making the only way to learn is to ask lots of question =D lol

Read full topic
item.source: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}

item.dc:creator: @Zian Zian

I launched my server after editing

 * This player's 'rank'
	 */

	/**
	 * The multiplier for subscribed players.
	 */
	private double premiumMultiplier = 60.0;

I edited the 60.0 to 1.0 but my EXP rates still seem to be a bit high/insane, does any one know the number I would have to put it at to make it normal EXP rates?

Oh, did I make a noob java mistake by not recompiling the server? or is recompiling it not needed?

item.title: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Zian, post:8, topic:236709”][quote author=bigh51 link=topic=312431.msg2489698#msg2489698 date=1224029747]

Fightevent.java.

???
player.java
[/quote]There is a combat exp rate formulae in Fightevent.java in the event folder, trust me.

Can you say the formulae code for me? I just want to know if I found the right thing…

[code] int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle())
{
case 0:
for(int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
attackerPlayer.incExp(x, exp / 3);

					break;
				case 1:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(2, exp);
					break;
				case 2:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(0, exp);
					break;
				case 3:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(1, exp);
					break;
			}
			
  			attackerPlayer.incExp(3, exp / 3);
  			attackerPlayer.getActionSender().sendStats();[/code]

Easy way is to find your player.java ctrl+f search ‘‘rank’’, scroll down to next few lines…

And edit this 60.0;

Set it to whatever exp rate you like, 20.0; 30.0; etc.

[code] * This player’s ‘rank’
*/
private int rank = 0;

/**
 * The multiplier for subscribed players.
 */
private double premiumMultiplier = 60.0;[/code]

THANKS you are awesome, I was having issues finding it because I was searching for “EXP” not “RANK”, one more question. Where is my character files saved to? and how do I go about editing them? do I have to open up a MySQL editor to edit the accounts? or can they just be opened in Notepad or Notepad++?[/quote]Yes, that’s the right thing.
You have to open up a MySQL editor like phpmyadmin to edit accounts.

Read full topic
item.source: RSC Private server help needed {Divine PK V5.0}

item.description:

[quote=“bigh51, post:4, topic:236709”][quote author=i own you21 link=topic=312431.msg2489694#msg2489694 date=1224029655]

Fightevent.java.

???
player.java
[/quote]There is a combat exp rate formulae in Fightevent.java in the event folder, trust me.[/quote]

Can you say the formulae code for me? I just want to know if I found the right thing…

[code] int exp = Formulae.roundUp(((opponent.getCombatLevel() * 2) + 10) * 1.5);
switch(attackerPlayer.getCombatStyle())
{
case 0:
for(int x = 0; x < 3; x++)
attackerPlayer.incExp(x, exp / 3);

					break;
				case 1:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(2, exp);
					break;
				case 2:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(0, exp);
					break;
				case 3:
					attackerPlayer.incExp(1, exp);
					break;
			}
			
  			attackerPlayer.incExp(3, exp / 3);
  			attackerPlayer.getActionSender().sendStats();[/code]

[quote=“elyad, post:6, topic:236709”]Easy way is to find your player.java ctrl+f search ‘‘rank’’, scroll down to next few lines…

And edit this 60.0;

Set it to whatever exp rate you like, 20.0; 30.0; etc.

[code] * This player’s ‘rank’
*/
private int rank = 0;

/**
 * The multiplier for subscribed players.
 */
private double premiumMultiplier = 60.0;[/code][/quote]

THANKS you are awesome, I was having issues finding it because I was searching for “EXP” not “RANK”, one more question. Where is my character files saved to? and how do I go about editing them? do I have to open up a MySQL editor to edit the accounts? or can they just be opened in Notepad or Notepad++?

Read full topic
